definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: In a trice, the street was empty.
sentences.chinese: 转眼之间，大街上就空无一人。

sentences.english: The first is how empty it was at al Asad Air Base, where he landed.
sentences.chinese: 第一个就是他落地的阿萨德空军基地空无一人。

sentences.english: The streets were empty because many folks smarter than I were still asleep.
sentences.chinese: 街上空无一人，很多比我聪明的人还都在睡梦之中。

sentences.english: It was New Year's Eve and the snowed streets were deserted.
sentences.chinese: 这是元旦夜和雪的街道空无一人。

sentences.english: The village was deserted because of the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 因为地震，这个村子变得空无一人。
五车道的高速公路几乎空无一人。

sentences.english: Dorms with Sunrise or at Dusk; an ancient empty street; below skirts.
sentences.chinese: 清晨或日落下的房间，空无一人的古老街道，裙下。

sentences.english: At this time of the morning, the arcade was almost empty.
sentences.chinese: 在早晨的这个时候，拱廊街上几乎空无一人。

sentences.english: Kim looks around the empty road, and calls out for her mother.
sentences.chinese: 金姆环视着空无一人的道路，大声呼叫她的母亲。

sentences.english: Whenever sang my songs on the stage, on my own!
sentences.chinese: 每当我站在空无一人的舞台上宛若呓语般歌唱时。

sentences.english: In the lonely lane there is no passer-by, the wind is up, the ripples are rampant in the river.
sentences.chinese: 孤寂的小路上空无一人，起风了，河里泛起阵阵涟漪。

sentences.english: The sun shines on the empty seafront in Mombasa, Kenya.
sentences.chinese: 阳光明媚，肯尼亚蒙巴萨岛的海滩上却空无一人。

sentences.english: On waking one morning, B was surprised to see that Shepperton was deserted.
sentences.chinese: 早晨一醒来，B惊讶地发现谢伯顿空无一人了。

sentences.english: Now the sand-swept sites stand nearly empty.
sentences.chinese: 如今这些沙漠景点几乎空无一人。

sentences.english: I looked through the open door, but the room was empty.
sentences.chinese: 通过敞开的门向里看，我看到屋里空无一人。

sentences.english: When the desk was clear of people, I still waited.
sentences.chinese: 桌边已经空无一人了，我仍在等着。

definition: as empty as anything (idiom); completely bereft/to have nothing/vacuous/hollow/empty (argument, head etc)
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
in a mess/scattered about/in complete disorder
